title: Australia news live: NSW flood death toll rises; Michael McCormack says he is ‘ambitious’ for Littleproud, in echo of Scott Morrison
snippets:
BoM says heavy rainfall will extend south through NSW today with some areas set to receive up to 160mm. Follow today’s news live

  • Get our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcast

Darren Chester says focus on Coalition split ‘frustrating’

Nationals MP Darren Chester says “there are bigger issues” than the makeup of the coalition.

It’s been frustrating to be talking about ourselves at a time when, you know, much of the mid coast, the central coast and north coast of New South Wales is facing devastating floods including loss of life. And in close to home in Victoria central and western Victoria and northern Victoria right through South Australia there’s a devastating drought.

We need to resolve our issues as quickly as we can, because there are bigger issues facing rural and regional Australians than the make-up of the coalition. We need to make sure we get back being a strong and incredible opposition as quickly as possible and I’m hoping that these negotiations can consider – can continue now in a positive and constructive way.

Continue reading...

title: Authorities investigate shooting of Israeli embassy staffers as a hate crime and act of terrorism – live
snippets:
Suspect faces two counts of first-degree murder for shooting deaths of two Israeli embassy staffers

  • Suspect charged with murder in shooting of Israeli embassy staffers

Israel’s foreign minister, Gideon Sa’ar, has accused unnamed European officials of “toxic antisemitic incitement” he blamed for a hostile climate in which the fatal shooting of two Israeli embassy staffers in Washington took place, Reuters reports.

Israel has faced a blizzard of criticism from Europe of late as it has intensified its military campaign in Gaza, where humanitarian groups have warned that an 11-week Israeli blockade on aid supplies has left the Palestinian territory on the brink of famine.

Continue reading...

titles: Authorities investigate shooting of Israeli embassy staffers as a hate crime and act of terrorism – live
Authorities investigate shooting of Israeli embassy staffers as a hate crime and act of terrorism – live
summary: A suspect has been charged with two counts of first-degree murder following the fatal shooting of two Israeli embassy staffers in Washington, D.C. Israel's Foreign Minister Gideon Sa’ar attributed the attack to a climate of "toxic antisemitic incitement" by unnamed European officials, amid criticism of Israel's intensified military actions in Gaza. This criticism comes as humanitarian groups warn that an 11-week Israeli blockade has pushed Gaza to the verge of famine.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information about an ongoing investigation into a serious crime, contributing to the reader's understanding of the situation. title: Hidden DNA Mutation Raises Prostate Cancer Risk Fivefold – And May Help Target Treatment
snippets: A newly identified mutation dramatically raises prostate cancer risk in Ashkenazi Jewish men and may increase sensitivity to targeted cancer therapies. This genetic clue not only improves our understanding of inherited cancer risks but could also inform personalized treatment strategies using drugs like PARP inhibitors. A Breakthrough Discovery in Prostate Cancer Genetics Understanding gene mutations, [...]
titles: Hidden DNA Mutation Raises Prostate Cancer Risk Fivefold – And May Help Target Treatment
summary: Researchers have discovered a genetic mutation that significantly increases the risk of prostate cancer in Ashkenazi Jewish men by fivefold. This mutation also suggests that affected individuals may respond better to targeted cancer treatments, such as PARP inhibitors. This breakthrough enhances the understanding of inherited cancer risks and has the potential to guide personalized treatment plans for those carrying the mutation.
constructiveness_reason: This story is highly constructive as it provides readers with an understanding of a new genetic mutation linked to prostate cancer. It not only increases awareness about inherited cancer risks, but also reports on potential solutions for targeted cancer treatments. The information can be useful for Ashkenazi Jewish men and healthcare professionals in decision-making.

title: Scientists Unveil New Antibody That Supercharges Immune Attack on Tumors
snippets: The antibody PLT012 targets the fat transporter CD36 to restore immune responses in tumors, offering a new and promising approach to treating immunotherapy-resistant cancers. A new study from Ludwig Cancer Research has uncovered a key mechanism by which immune cells within tumors take up fat, a process that functions as a metabolic checkpoint, suppressing the [...]
titles: Scientists Unveil New Antibody That Supercharges Immune Attack on Tumors
summary: Scientists from Ludwig Cancer Research have developed a new antibody, PLT012, that targets the fat transporter CD36, enhancing the immune system's ability to attack tumors. This discovery offers a novel approach to treating cancers resistant to current immunotherapies by restoring immune responses within tumors. The study reveals how immune cells in tumors absorb fat, a mechanism that suppresses their function, and how PLT012 can counteract this process.
constructiveness_reason: This story is constructive as it reports on a significant innovation in cancer treatment. It enhances understanding of how immune cells in tumors function and how the new antibody can counteract tumor growth. The story provides actionable insights for healthcare professionals and patients looking for alternative treatments for resistant cancers.

title: Diabetes Drug Stops Prostate Cancer From Coming Back
snippets: A diabetes drug may hold the key to preventing prostate cancer relapse. Scientists discovered that prostate cancer patients with diabetes who took PPARy-targeting drugs stayed cancer-free during follow-up. The drug, pioglitazone, appears to rewire cancer cell metabolism and suppress growth. Promising Drug Discovery in Prostate Cancer In a discovery that could open new doors for [...]
titles: Diabetes Drug Stops Prostate Cancer From Coming Back
summary: A study has found that the diabetes drug pioglitazone may prevent prostate cancer relapse. Researchers observed that prostate cancer patients with diabetes, who were treated with PPARγ-targeting drugs like pioglitazone, remained cancer-free during the follow-up period. The drug is believed to alter cancer cell metabolism and inhibit growth, suggesting a potential new treatment approach for prostate cancer.
constructiveness_reason: This story is constructive as it reports on a potential new approach to treating prostate cancer using a diabetes drug. It provides useful insights into how the drug alters cancer cell metabolism and inhibits growth. However, it could provide more context on the prevalence of prostate cancer and the significance of this finding in the broader landscape of cancer treatment.

title: New dwarf planet spotted at the edge of the solar system
snippets: The unusual orbit of a possible dwarf planet, known as 2017 OF201, makes it less likely that our solar system contains a hidden ninth “Planet X”
titles: New dwarf planet spotted at the edge of the solar system
summary: Astronomers studying the orbit of a potential dwarf planet, 2017 OF201, have found its trajectory suggests a hidden ninth planet, often referred to as "Planet X," is less likely to exist within our solar system. This conclusion is based on the characteristics of 2017 OF201's orbit, challenging previous theories about the presence of an undiscovered large planet influencing the orbits of distant solar system objects.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information about the ongoing research in astronomy, specifically about the existence of a potential ninth planet in our solar system. It increases awareness about the methods and theories used in the field, and about how new discoveries can challenge previous assumptions. However, it does not report on any solutions or improvements, and the actionable insights for the general reader are limited.

title: Ultracold atoms have been 'hyperentangled' for the first time

titles: Ultracold atoms have been 'hyperentangled' for the first time

This advancement in quantum physics demonstrates an unprecedented level of control over the entanglement of atomic properties, marking a significant milestone in the field.
constructiveness_reason: This story reports on a significant innovation in the field of quantum physics, marking it high in terms of progress.
